title: Strategy & Operations Business Partner
content:
Who we are 
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe has a growing focus on Enterprise and large Digital Native customers who are demanding access to highly qualified individuals to assist with the deployment of Stripe products and services. Professional Services is the team that provides implementation consultants and engineers to assist these customers. Our team provides the Strategy & Operational support to those consultants, engineers and their leadership. Support is provided across three pillars:

Strategy and planning
Operations
Analytics and insights

Within the GTM Strategy & Operations organization, our team, Professional Services Strategy & Operations is focused on driving business changes across tooling, processes and policies.  We facilitate incremental Stripe productivity improvements to help Professional Services deliver solutions and drive Stripe Revenue.  We are a global team with resources in the Americas, Europe and Asia Pacific. Our team has a mix of business partners working directly with Professional Services teams at a strategic consulting level, as well as hands-on technical resources administering the tools, driving data and analytics, and executing on operational activities.
What you’ll do
Our team is still very nascent, with the majority of our near term focus on building business foundations, which necessarily entails a focus on operational projects (process design, business cadences, systems work). The PSSO business partner is the right-hand person to their Professional Services leaders on everything related to planning and running their business, including: org design and planning, partner/sales coverage models, setting SOKRs, measuring and providing insights on performance, forecasting, and process improvement. 
Responsibilities

Drive 1yr/4yr planning and related cross-functional planning processes.
Set annual and quarterly SOKRs and track performance.
Define Professional Services roles and coverage models.
Build reports and dashboards for key reporting needs.
Prepare for QBRs and other leadership meetings.
Manage cross-functional pre-sales processes with other teams. 
Operationalize product GTM processes where it impacts the Professional Services teams.
Working cross-functionally to investigate and do analysis on system issues.
Create JIRA Tickets for system enhancements.
System and operational workflow management analysis and investigation. 
Improve business processes through data driven decisions.
Provide user and project administration.

Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

10+ years of operations experience in a software solutions or technology company.
5+ years working with a Professional Services organization.
Data Analytics (Google Sheets/Excel data manipulation, SQL).
Working on ticket management in JIRA.
Business and operational SLA reporting.
Business requirement and user story documentation.
Communicate clearly, proactively, and concisely. 
Self-starter and comfortable dealing with ambiguity.

Preferred qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Tableau or SFDC report development experience.
Experience as a User and Report developer in Salesforce.com.
Kantata or similar PSA Tool Experience, NOT Necessary, we will provide all training, but nice if it is available.

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
